headline: Musk Confronts Microsoft CEO Over Alleged Employee Remarks On Charlie Kirk's Assassination
summary: Elon Musk has challenged Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella over comments allegedly made by employees of Microsoft’s gaming division, Activision Blizzard, celebrating the assassination of conservative commentator Charlie Kirk. The contentious posts were supposedly made by developers and employees of Activision Blizzard on social media platform X. headline: Tesla's German plant plans to lift production, factory boss tells DPA news agency
summary: BERLIN (Reuters) -U.S. electric carmaker Tesla plans to raise production at its German plant for the rest of the year due to strong sales, the head of the Gruenheide factory told Germany's DPA news agency on Sunday.  “We currently have very good sales figures and have therefore revised our production plans for the third and fourth quarters upwards,” André Thierig, manager of the Gruenheide plant outside Berlin, told DPA.  Germany is a tough market for Tesla due in part to stiff competition from Chinese rivals.

raw.headline: Tesla's German plant plans to lift production, factory boss tells DPA news agency

Germany is a tough market for Tesla due in part to stiff competition from Chinese rivals.

headline: Vivek Ramaswamy Sells $22.7 Million of Roivant Sciences Stock
summary: Vivek Ramaswamy sold more than $22 million worth of  Roivant Sciences  stock in three separate transactions last week, according to a filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.  Ramaswamy founded Roivant Sciences in 2014 and served as CEO until 2021.  A Form 4 filed with the agency last week shows Ramaswamy sold 1,195,000 shares for $12.50 each on Sept. 3.
